title.narrative: STRENGTHENING LOCAL CAPACITY TO LEAD EVIDENCE-BASED CONSERVATION OF SAIGA IN THEIR NATIVE HABITATS IN KAZAKHSTAN AND UZBEKISTAN

description.narrative: IN THIS FOUR-YEAR PROJECT, FFI AND ITS PARTNERS WILL ADDRESS LOCAL DRIVERS OF POACHING AND TRAFFICKING OF CRITICALLY ENDANGERED SAIGA, FOCUSED ON THE URAL, BETPAK-DALA, AND USTYURT POPULATIONS. THE PROJECTS OVERALL GOAL IS THAT SAIGA POPULATIONS IN KAZAKHSTAN AND UZBEKISTAN RECOVER AND FLOURISH THANKS TO EFFECTIVE, LOCALLY-LED IN-SITU PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION AND THE REDUCED THREAT OF POACHING AND INTERNATIONAL TRAFFICKING. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE PROJECT WILL PURSUE THREE, INTEGRATED OBJECTIVES THAT ARE UNDERPINNED BY AN OVERALL STRATEGIC APPROACH, WHICH STRESSES INDIVIDUAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING TO PROTECT AND CONSERVE SAIGA IN THEIR NATIVE HABITATS NOW AND INTO THE FUTURE BUILDING AND LEVERAGING EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF EFFECTIVE CONSERVATION ACTION AND INCREASING THE USE OF SITUATIONAL CRIME PREVENTION (SCP) AS A KEY TOOL TOWARDS STOPPING THE THREATS OF POACHING AND TRAFFICKING. IF WE ARE SUCCESSFUL, WE WILL ENABLE SMARTER CONSERVATION PRACTICE AND CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AND LOCAL AND NATIONAL AUTHORITIES TO INTERVENE PRE-CRIME, INCLUDING THROUGH GREATER PATROL EFFECTIVENESS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND THEREBY REDUCE POACHING AND TRAFFICKING. PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO: BUILD THE KNOWLEDGE, CAPACITY, AND MOTIVATION OF AT LEAST 60 LOCAL SAIGA

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management
